titleStmt.title: A true and exact relation of the late prodigious earthquake and eruption of Mount Ætna, or, Monte-Gibello as it came in a letter written to his Majesty from Naples by the Right Honourable the Earle of Winchilsea, His Majesties late ambassador at Constantinople, who in his return from thence, visiting Catania in the island of Sicily, was an eye-witnesse of that dreadfull spectacle. Together with a more particular narrative of the same as it is collected out of several relations sent from Catania. Published by authority.
titleStmt.author: Winchilsea, Heneage Finch, Earl of, d. 1689.

notesStmt.note: The Earle of Winchilsea = Heneage Finch.
Caption title on p. [5]: A particular narrative of the late dreadful earthquake, and irruption as it is collected out of several relations from Catania.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
